meanings.definition: A path or trail made by the passage of animals or vehicles.
meanings.sent1: The deer followed the trackway through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The bike rode smoothly along the trackway in the park.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to use the trackway as a shortcut to its nest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed along the trackway of memories in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The trackway of paw prints in the snow led us to the lost puppy.

meanings.definition: A set of parallel tracks or grooves for wheels to run on.
meanings.sent1: The train wheels clicked along the trackway.
meanings.sent2: The roller coaster glided along the trackway with ease.
meanings.sent3: The skateboarder attempted a trick on the trackway, but failed spectacularly.
meanings.sent4: Her life seemed to be stuck on a trackway, going in circles.
meanings.sent5: The trackway of tire marks on the road indicated a sudden turn.

meanings.definition: A series of connected tracks or footprints left by a person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The detective carefully examined the trackway left by the suspect.
meanings.sent2: The dinosaur trackway in the museum fascinated the children.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully danced along the trackway of yarn.
meanings.sent4: His words left a trackway of doubt in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The trackway of footprints in the sand disappeared with the incoming tide.
